question.title: Pattern 16
question.content:
Geek is very fond of patterns. Once, his teacher gave him a pattern to solve. He gave Geek an integer n and asked him to build a pattern.

Help Geek to build the pattern.

 

Example 1:

Input: 5

Output:
A
BB
CCC
DDDD
EEEEE

Your Task:

You don't need to input anything. Complete the function printTriangle() which takes  an integer n  as the input parameter and print the pattern.

Constraints:

  • 1<= N <= 20

rephrased.body: Given an integer `n`, construct a pattern where the i-th row consists of the i-th letter of the alphabet repeated i times.

testcases.explanation: The pattern for n=5 consists of 'A' repeated once, 'B' repeated twice, and so on, up to 'E' repeated five times.

py.full_func:
#Back-end complete function Template for Python 3

class Solution:

    #Function to print a triangle of characters.
    def printTriangle(self, N):
        for i in range(65, 65 + N):  #Iterating over the range of characters from 65 to 65+N.
            for j in range(65, i + 1):  #Iterating over the range of characters from 65 to i+1.
                print(chr(i), end = '')  #Printing the character in the range as per the ASCII value.
            print()  #Printing a new line after each iteration.
